definition: Captain James Cook (1728-1779), British navigator and explorer

sentences.english: The Tahitians taught Captain Cook and his sailors how to make tattoos.
sentences.chinese: 海地人教会了库克船长和他的海员们如何制作纹身。

sentences.english: The captain was drunk in his cabin.
sentences.chinese: 船长在他的船舱里喝醉了。

sentences.english: Neither the captain, the first mate, nor the second mate ever worked again.
sentences.chinese: 船长，大副和二副从此以后再也不一起工作了。

sentences.english: As soon as the captain heard the sound of the lock being turned, he stepped forward.
sentences.chinese: 一听到锁的转动声，船长就立刻一步跨世上前去。

sentences.english: The captain put the wheel over and steered northwest.
sentences.chinese: 船长转动舵轮，向西北方向驶去。

sentences.english: Says captain smollett , as cool as can be.
sentences.chinese: 斯莫列特船长说，尽可能地保持着冷静。

sentences.english: After succeeding in landing on George Island, the captain sent a radio message to his headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 胜利登上乔治岛后，船长向指挥部发了一份无线电报。

sentences.english: All the crew must submit to the shipmaster's aforementioned decisions unconditionally.
sentences.chinese: 所有船员必须无条件地服从船长做出的上述决定。

sentences.english: Next best thing to tell the truth, ' muttered Captain Smollett. 'Load his gun, Hawkins.
sentences.chinese: “讲实话也算不错，”斯莫列特船长咕哝道。

sentences.english: He knew he exceeded that. He doubled it.
sentences.chinese: 船长知道船的载货量已经超出一倍了。

sentences.english: When?" "When the captain wants it to blow."
sentences.chinese: 多会儿响？““船长让它响时，“

sentences.english: The captain ordered the crew to square away and sail before the wind.
sentences.chinese: 船长命令水手迎风扬帆，乘风行驶。

sentences.english: After the entertainment the captain obtained an entrance fee.
sentences.chinese: 娱乐表演之后，船长获得了一笔入场费。
